briefdescription.para: Symbol for drawing pages.
Constructor for QgsLayoutItemPage, with the specified parent layout.
Adds a page to the collection.

detaileddescription.para: Ownership of the page is transferred to the collection, and the page will automatically be added to the collection's layout() (there is no need to manually add the page item to the layout). The page will be added after all pages currently contained in the collection.
Calling addPage() automatically triggers a reflow() of pages.

briefdescription.para: Should be called before changing any page item sizes, and followed by a call to endPageSizeChange().

detaileddescription.para:
If page size changes are wrapped in these calls, then items will maintain their same relative position on pages after the page sizes are updated.
endPageSizeChange()

briefdescription.para: Removes all pages from the collection.
Deletes a page from the collection.

detaileddescription.para: The page will automatically be removed from the collection's layout().
Page numbers in collections begin at 0 - so a pageNumber of 0 will delete the first page in the collection.
Calling deletePage() automatically triggers a reflow() of pages.

briefdescription.para: Deletes a page from the collection.

detaileddescription.para: The page will automatically be removed from the collection's layout().
Calling deletePage() automatically triggers a reflow() of pages.

briefdescription.para: Should be called after changing any page item sizes, and preceded by a call to beginPageSizeChange().

detaileddescription.para:
If page size changes are wrapped in these calls, then items will maintain their same relative position on pages after the page sizes are updated.
beginPageSizeChange()

briefdescription.para: Adds a new page to the end of the collection.

detaileddescription.para: This page will inherit the same size as the current final page in the collection.
The newly created page will be returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns a reference to the collection's guide collection, which manages page snap guides.
Returns a reference to the collection's guide collection, which manages page snap guides.
Returns true if the layout has uniform page sizes, e.g.

detaileddescription.para: all pages are the same size.
This method does not consider differing units as non-uniform sizes, only the actual physical size of the pages.

briefdescription.para: Inserts a page into a specific position in the collection.

detaileddescription.para: Ownership of the page is transferred to the collection, and the page will automatically be added to the collection's layout() (there is no need to manually add the page item to the layout).
The page will be added after before the page number specified by beforePage. (Page numbers in collections begin at 0 - so a beforePage of 0 will insert the page before all existing pages).
Calling insertPage() automatically triggers a reflow() of pages.

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of layout items on the specified page index.
Returns layout items of a specific type on a specified page.
Returns the layout the object belongs to.
Returns the maximum size of any page in the collection, by area.

detaileddescription.para: The returned value is in layout units.

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum width of pages in the collection.

detaileddescription.para: The returned value is in layout units.

briefdescription.para: Returns a specific page (by pageNumber) from the collection.

detaileddescription.para:
Internal page numbering starts at 0 - so a pageNumber of 0 corresponds to the first page in the collection. A nullptr is returned if an invalid page number is specified.
pages()

briefdescription.para: Returns a specific page (by pageNumber) from the collection.

detaileddescription.para:
Internal page numbering starts at 0 - so a pageNumber of 0 corresponds to the first page in the collection. A nullptr is returned if an invalid page number is specified.
pages()
Not available in Python bindings.

briefdescription.para: Returns the page at a specified point (in layout coordinates).

detaileddescription.para: If no page exists at point, nullptr will be returned.

simplesect.para: Unlike pageNumberForPoint(), this method only returns pages which directly intersect with the specified point.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of pages in the collection.
Returns whether a given page index is empty, ie, it contains no items except for the background paper item.
Returns the page number for the specified page, or -1 if the page is not contained in the collection.
Returns the page number corresponding to a point in the layout (in layout units).

detaileddescription.para: Page numbers in collections begin at 0 - so a page number of 0 indicates the first page.

simplesect.para: This is a relaxed check, which will always return a page number. For instance, it does not consider x coordinates and vertical coordinates before the first page or after the last page will still return the nearest page.

briefdescription.para: Converts a position on a page to an absolute position in (maintaining the units from the input position).
Converts a position on a page to an absolute position in layout coordinates.

detaileddescription.para:
\
pagePositionToAbsolute()

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of pages in the collection.
Returns the size of the page shadow, in layout units.
Returns the symbol to use for drawing pages in the collection.
Returns the position within a page of a point in the layout (in layout units).
Returns the theoretical page number corresponding to a point in the layout (in layout units), assuming that enough pages exist in the layout to cover that point.

detaileddescription.para: If there are insufficient pages currently in the layout, this method will assume that extra "imaginary" pages have been added at the end of the layout until that point is reached. These imaginary pages will inherit the size of the existing final page in the layout.
Page numbers in collections begin at 0 - so a page number of 0 indicates the first page.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QDomElement &collectionElement, const QDomDocument &document, const QgsReadWriteContext &context) override
memberdef.name: readXml

briefdescription.para: Sets the collection's state from a DOM element.

detaileddescription.para:
collectionElement is the DOM node corresponding to the collection.
writeXml()

briefdescription.para: Forces the page collection to reflow the arrangement of pages, e.g.

detaileddescription.para: to account for page size/orientation change.

briefdescription.para: Resizes the layout to a single page which fits the current contents of the layout.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this method resets the number of pages to 1, with the size set to the minimum size required to fit all existing layout items. Items will also be repositioned so that the new top-left bounds of the layout is at the point (marginLeft, marginTop). An optional margin can be specified.

briefdescription.para: Sets the symbol to use for drawing pages in the collection.

detaileddescription.para:
Ownership is not transferred, and a copy of the symbol is created internally.
pageStyleSymbol()

briefdescription.para: Returns whether the specified page number should be included in exports of the layouts.

simplesect.para: This will always return true unless the layout is being currently exported it cannot be used in advance to determine whether a given page will be exported!

briefdescription.para: Returns the space between pages, in layout units.
Returns the object type as a string.

detaileddescription.para: This string must be a unique, single word, character only representation of the item type, eg "LayoutScaleBar"

briefdescription.para: Takes a page from the collection, returning ownership of the page to the caller.
Returns a list of the page numbers which are visible within the specified region (in layout coordinates).
Returns a list of the pages which are visible within the specified region (in layout coordinates).
Stores the collection's state in a DOM element.

detaileddescription.para:
The parentElement should refer to the parent layout's DOM element.
readXml()

briefdescription.para: Triggers a redraw for all pages.
Emitted when pages are added or removed from the collection.
Emitted just before a page is removed from the collection.

detaileddescription.para: Page numbers in collections begin at 0 - so a page number of 0 indicates the first page.

briefdescription.para: A manager for a collection of pages in a layout.
